All Implemented Interfaces:
com.telenav.kivakit.component.Component, com.telenav.kivakit.core.function.ResultTrait, com.telenav.kivakit.core.language.trait.LanguageTrait, com.telenav.kivakit.core.language.trait.SilentTryTrait, com.telenav.kivakit.core.language.trait.TryTrait, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Broadcaster, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Listener, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Repeater, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Transceiver, com.telenav.kivakit.core.project.ProjectTrait, com.telenav.kivakit.core.registry.RegistryTrait, com.telenav.kivakit.core.vm.JavaTrait, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.code.TripwireTrait, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.messaging.Receiver, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.messaging.Transmitter, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.naming.NamedObject, com.telenav.kivakit.resource.packages.PackageTrait, com.telenav.kivakit.settings.SettingsTrait, Closeable, AutoCloseable
public class StaxReader extends com.telenav.kivakit.component.BaseComponent implements Closeable

A thin wrapper around Java's STAX XML stream API (java.xml.stream) that makes it easy to locate XML elements in the stream, including elements relative to XML StaxPaths.

Using a StaxReader

A STAX reader can be created with the open(Resource) method. The method will either successfully return a StaxReader or it will throw and exception. After information from the resource's XML stream has been processed, the reader can be closed with close(). Since StaxReader implements Closeable, it can be used within a try-with-resources statement.

Reader State

These methods give the reader's position in the XML stream and its current element:

  • path() - The current StaxPath the reader is at
  • at() - The element that the STAX parser is at

Moving Through the Stream

The following methods advance the reader to a subsequent element in the stream.

  • hasNext() - True if the reader has more elements
  • next() - Advances the reader to the next element
  • nextAttribute() - Advances to the next XML attribute
  • nextCharacters() - Advances to the next text element
  • nextCloseTag() - Advances to the next close tag
  • nextMatching(Matcher) - Advances to the next element matching the given matcher
  • nextOpenTag() - Advances to the next open tag
  • nextAtOrInside(StaxPath, Matcher) - Advances ot the next element matching the given matcher that is at or under the given StaxPath
  • enclosedText() - If the stream is at an open tag and the next element is a text element, returns the text element and advances to the close tag.

Stream Positioning

The following methods help to determine where the reader is positioned in the XML input stream.

  • isAtEnd() - True if the reader is at the end of the XML stream
  • isAtCharacters() - True if the reader is at a text element
  • isAtOpenTag() - True if the reader is at an open tag
  • isAtCloseTag() ()} - True if the reader is at a close tag
  • isAtOpenCloseTag() - True if the reader is at an "open close" tag like <tag/>

StaxPath Positioning Operations

The following methods test the position of the reader relative to a given StaxPath. The reader is considered at a given path if the sequence of elements leading to the current element (the reader's path) is equal to the given path. For example, if the reader is at the hierarchical element path a/b/c and the given path is a/b/c, the reader is at the given path. The reader is inside a path if the given path is a prefix of the reader's current path. For example, if the reader is at a/b/c/d and the path is a/b/c, then the reader is inside the given path. Finally, the reader is outside the given path in the reverse situation, where the reader is at a/b and the path is a/b/c.

  • findNext(StaxPath) - Advances the reader to the next location where path() matches the given path
  • isAt(StaxPath) - True if the reader is at the level of the given StaxPath
  • isInside(StaxPath) - True if the reader is under the given StaxPath
  • isAtOrInside(StaxPath) - True if the reader is at or under the level of the given StaxPath
  • isOutside(StaxPath) - True if the reader is above the given StaxPath
Author:
jonathanl (shibo)

    • enclosedText

      public String enclosedText()
      Returns:
      The text enclosed by an open/end tag pair. Must be called at an open tag. The following character data is read and the XML stream is advanced to the close tag.

    • isInside

      public boolean isInside(StaxPath path)
      Returns:
      True if the this path is hierarchically "under" the given path. For example, if this path is a/b/c and the given path is /a/b, this method would return true. However, if this path was a/b/c, and the given path was /a/b/c or /a/b/c/d, it would return false.

    • isOutside

      public boolean isOutside(StaxPath path)
      Returns:
      True if this reader is at, or under, the given path

    • next

      public XMLEvent next()
      Returns:
      The next event, or null if there are no more events

    • nextAtOrInside

      public XMLEvent nextAtOrInside(StaxPath path, StaxReader.Matcher matcher)
      Parameters:
      path - The path to stay at or under (inside)
      matcher - The matcher to call
      Returns:
      The next matching element inside the given path, or null if the element couldn't be found before leaving the scope represented by the given path. If the element isn't found, the element returned by at() will be the one after the close tag where matching had to stop.

    • nextAttribute

      public Attribute nextAttribute()
      Returns:
      The next attribute, or an exception is thrown

    • nextCharacters

      public Characters nextCharacters()
      Returns:
      The next characters block, or an exception is thrown

    • nextCloseTag

      public EndElement nextCloseTag()
      Returns:
      The next close tag, or an exception is thrown

    • nextMatching

      public XMLEvent nextMatching(StaxReader.Matcher matcher)
      Parameters:
      matcher - The matcher
      Returns:
      The next XMLEvent matching the matcher or null if the matcher asked to stop. A failure occurs (throwing an exception) if a match cannot be found before the end of the XML stream.

    • nextOpenTag

      public StartElement nextOpenTag()
      Returns:
      The next open tag, or an exception is thrown
